topic: How to containerize WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to containerize WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Containerizing WebAssembly (WASM) Targets using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to containerize WebAssembly (WASM) targets utilizing FastAPI in a Python 3.12+ environment.
key_points: Understanding the basics of WebAssembly, FastAPI, and containerization.
Setting up a Python 3.12+ development environment.
Creating a simple WASM module using Rust or another supported language.
Integrating the WASM module with FastAPI using the `pydna` package.
Building and deploying the containerized application utilizing Docker.
Testing the functionality of the containerized FastAPI app with the integrated WASM module.

code_examples.code:
FROM python:3.12
WORKDIR /app
COPY . /app
RUN pip install fastapi pydna
CMD ["python", "main.py"]

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this tutorial.
It's recommended to use the latest versions of FastAPI and pydna packages.
caveats: Ensure you have Rust or another supported WASM language set up for building WASM modules.
Pay attention to Docker version and system requirements when deploying your containerized application.
